author: Benzinga
title: Ground News - LinkedIn's Advertising Boom: How It's Becoming the New Go-To Platform for Digital Marketers - Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT)
text:
Summary by Benzinga Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ: MSFT)-owned LinkedIn has recently significantly advanced in the digital advertising market. In 2023, its annual advertising revenue surged to nearly $4 billion, marking a 10.1% increase from the previous year. Research group Insider Intelligence forecasts a further 14.1% growth in 2024. This rise in revenue is attributed to heightened demand, causing a spike in advertisement prices on LinkedIn. Some marketing agency ex… Share menu More

DDR1 RAM Buyer's Guide DDR1 RAM (Double Data Rate 1 Random Access Memory) is an older type of memory module that was commonly used in computers around the early 2000s. If you're looking to upgrade or replace your DDR1 RAM, this buyer's guide is here to help you make an informed decision. Here are some key factors to consider before purchasing DDR1 RAM: Factors to Consider - Compatibility: DDR1 RAM is not compatible with all systems. Before purchasing, ensure that your computer's motherboard supports DDR1 RAM. - Memory Capacity: Determine the amount of DDR1 RAM you require based on your specific needs. Consider factors such as the operating system you're using, the applications you run, and the tasks you perform. - Speed and Latency: DDR1 RAM comes in various speeds, indicated in megahertz (MHz). Higher MHz ratings generally result in faster data transfer. Also, consider the latency, which determines the RAM's response time. - Manufacturer Reliability: Choose DDR1 RAM from reputable manufacturers known for their quality and reliability. Research and read reviews about the manufacturer before making a purchase. - Availability: Due to its age, DDR1 RAM may not be readily available in the market. Check online marketplaces, computer stores, and specialized vintage computer shops to find DDR1 RAM modules. Pros and Cons To help you further weigh your options, here are some advantages and disadvantages of DDR1 RAM:Pros: - Lower cost compared to newer RAM technologies. - Can work well for older systems and vintage computer enthusiasts. - Sufficient for basic computing tasks. Cons: - Limited availability due to being an outdated technology. - Slower speeds and lower capacity compared to newer RAM types. - Incompatibility with most modern motherboards. Frequently Asked Questions about 15 Amazing DDR1 RAM For 2023 [gaming PC](https://robots.net/tech/what-is-a-good-gaming-pc/)? No, DDR1 RAM is not compatible with most modern gaming PCs. DDR1 RAM is outdated and not suitable for high-performance computing. Check your computer’s motherboard specifications and search for DDR1 RAM support. You can find this information in your motherboard’s manual or by visiting the manufacturer’s website. No, DDR1 RAM modules are not backward compatible. They cannot be used in DDR2 or DDR3 slots, as each generation has a different design and pin configuration. [DDR3 RAM](https://robots.net/tech/what-does-ddr3-ram-mean/)in my system? No, it is not recommended to mix different [types of RAM](https://robots.net/tech/how-many-types-of-ram-are-there/) in a system. Mixing DDR1 with DDR2 or DDR3 RAM can lead to compatibility issues and system instability. It depends on your specific needs and the condition of your computer. If you only perform basic tasks such as web browsing, word processing, and light multimedia usage, upgrading to DDR1 RAM may provide a slight improvement. However, for demanding applications or gaming, upgrading to a newer RAM type would be more beneficial. Due to its obsolescence, it is highly unlikely to find new DDR1 RAM modules. However, you may be able to find used modules from reputable computer stores or online marketplaces. Just be cautious when purchasing used RAM and ensure it is tested and in good working condition.

author: Pedro Parra
title: 40 M€: el Manchester United se fija en una sensación de la Premier
text:
Premier League
40 M€: el Manchester United se fija en una sensación de la Premier
1 min.
@Maxppp
En medio de una etapa de transición que se está alargando más de lo previsto, el Manchester United está dispuesto a pasar a la acción en el mercado estival de fichajes. En esta ocasión, hay que enfocarse en la búsqueda de una nueva pieza para su vanguardia, así que se desliza la candidatura de Antoine Semenyo (25 años).
Sigue después de este anuncio
Según la información recogida por TMW, en Old Trafford están pendientes del rendimiento del extremo. Fundamental para Andoni Iraola en un Bournemouth al que está ligado hasta 2029, el futbolista también figura en la agenda del Tottenham Hotspur. Asimismo, The Cherries le han colocado a su pupilo una tasación de 40 M€.
Sigue después de este anuncio

author: Fox News
title: Massachusetts considers trust funds for the state’s poorest newborns to help ‘shrink the racial wealth gap’
text:
Massachusetts is considering trust funds, aimed at reducing the racial wealth gap, for the state’s poorest newborns that the recipients would be able to access when they turn 18.
The “baby bonds” would be an at-birth publicly funded trust fund program for
Massachusetts residents, to be used for college, buying a home or starting a business. The amount given to each eligible newborn would depend on their household income, although it doesn’t give a maximum amount or specify who would qualify for the funds.
“Children born into households with low income (which are disproportionately households of color) are prioritized through eligibility requirements set by the state or through a progressive allocation system, with those with the lowest income receiving the largest investments,” the Massachusetts state government
says on its website. “This is to provide the most support to children born with the least resources, and to shrink the racial wealth gap.”
The trust funds aim to narrow the racial wealth gap in Massachusetts, as well as increase “access to financial education, closing the race and gender wage gap, addressing racial equity, expanding
college affordability, and promoting STEM education.”
The program could cost the state roughly $52 million annually with an estimated 8,000 infants qualifying each year in Massachusetts, The
Boston Globe reported. In March 2022, the State Treasurer Deborah Goldberg announced at the Economic Empowerment Trust Fund board meeting that she was convening a task force to explore the creation of Baby Bonds in Massachusetts.
Goldberg
told The Globe that officials have not yet identified a funding source for the program, but that it will “hopefully… be a priority” that “will receive the kind of funding it needs.”
Democratic state Sen. Paul R. Feeley, who introduced the bill in Massachusetts, said the trust funds would “build wealth from the bottom up,” putting poorer people “on a trajectory for real opportunity from day one,” The
Daily Mail reported.
“By investing at the start of a child’s life, we are providing a jump-start to individuals otherwise at a disadvantage by beginning to narrow the racial wealth gap and giving our most vulnerable residents a fighting shot at the middle class and the American Dream,” Feeley said.
A national version of the law, the
American Opportunity Accounts Act, which has stalled in Congress, proposes giving each child a $1,000 seed deposit at birth, followed by annual deposits of up to $2,000 based on their parents’ income. Children from the lowest-income families could accrue $46,215 by the time they turn 18, while qualifying families in the highest income bracket could accrue around $1,681, according to the Daily Mail.
In Connecticut, which has its own infant trust fund, low-income babies are given a one-time deposit of $3,200, which is held in the bonds and accrues interest until they are 18, according to Massachusetts Baby Bonds task force
findings. In Washington, D.C., any child born in the district on or after October 1, 2021, to a family enrolled in Medicaid with an income of 300% of the Federal Poverty Line, is eligible to receive an initial deposit of at least $500.
Similarly, California approved a trust fund of up to $8,000 each for children who lost a parent or guardian to COVID-19. Baby bond proposals are also under consideration in Iowa, New Jersey, New York, and Wisconsin.
The post
Massachusetts considers trust funds for the state’s poorest newborns to help ‘shrink the racial wealth gap’ appeared first on Fox News.

author: Nhari Djan
title: Global Screenwriters Unions Pass A.I. Resolution With 5 Principles | Observer
text: A coalition of screenwriters unions passed a joint resolution today (April 11) with proposed industry standards for [the use of A.I.](https://observer.com/2023/09/hollywood-writer-strike-ai/) Members of the Federation of Screenwriters in Europe (FSE), representing 26 screenwriters organizations from 21 European countries, and the International Affiliation of Writers Guilds (IAWG), representing 12 unions in 14 countries, have teamed up to put forward five guiding principles to prevent any form of A.I. from [replacing human writers](https://observer.com/2024/03/ai-hollywood-sara-poyner-bbc-documentary/). The five principles are: - Affirm that only writers create literary material and that large language models (LLMs) or any other present or future forms of A.I. cannot be used in place of writers; - Work to create mechanisms for obligatory transparency and accountability and to ensure writers are informed if A.I.-generated material is used to write, rewrite, polish or perform any additional writing services; - Advocate for robust licensing mechanisms that require explicit and informed consent for the use of writers’ intellectual property in A.I. training data with a goal to ensure only intellectual property that has been licensed for such use be included in the datasets of commercialized LLMs, or any other present or future forms of A.I.; - Ensure that only human beings are entitled to authors rights and recognized under copyright law in the context of machine generated material; - Advocate for fair remuneration for the use of writers’ intellectual property in LLMs or any other present or future forms of A.I. The Writers Guild of America (WGA) was credited for inspiring the passage of the resolution. “The members of the IAWG seek to build on the hard-won protections our sister Guilds in America, the WGAE and the WGAW, were able to achieve during their strike: namely that it should be a tool to enhance our writing process, not diminish the value of our work or replace us,” [Jennifer Davidson](https://observer.com/person/jennifer-davidson/), an Irish screenwriter who chairs the IAWG, said in a statement. When the WGA won its contract last year following a 148-day strike, it established A.I. protections with the studios which included prohibiting A.I.-generated material from being used as source material and requiring companies to disclose to writers if they will be dealing with A.I.-generated materials. Last month, the European Union passed [the AI Act](https://artificialintelligenceact.eu/the-act/), the world’s first comprehensive legislation to address the use of A.I. German screenwriter and FSE President [Carolin Otto](https://observer.com/person/carolin-otto/) said in a statement that the regulation still leaves some “unresolved issues” around using intellectual property to train large language models (LLM) and with authorship and copyright. “We intend to voice our concerns in both national and global policy arenas, as well as develop standard language film and television writers can demand in their contracts,” Otto said.

author: Mitchell Crow
title: Which continent has the cleanest air?
text:
Which continent has the cleanest air?
The continent that has the cleanest air on Earth is Antarctica. According to experts, Antarctica is isolated from pollution and dust from other continents, making it the world’s most pristine and pollution-free environment.
1. Where on Earth has the cleanest air?
Experts say that the cleanest air on Earth can be found over the Southern Ocean near Antarctica. It is known for its purity and lack of pollution, making it the cleanest air in the world.
2. What place stands out for offering the cleanest air to visitors?
Cape Grim, a peninsula located near the north-western tip of Tasmania, near Australia, is known for offering the cleanest air to visitors. Its remoteness and isolation contribute to its unique and clean air quality.
3. Which is the cleanest continent on Earth?
Antarctica is considered the cleanest continent on Earth. It is isolated from pollution and dust from other continents, making its air quality the purest and free from particles caused by human activity.
4. Which country has the world’s best air quality?
Various countries are known for having excellent air quality. Some countries with the best air quality include Bolivia, Suriname, Norway, Sweden, Belize, Andorra, Trinidad & Tobago, and Finland. These countries have consistently low levels of air pollution.
5. Where is the purest air quality?
In 2022, Zurich, Switzerland was identified as having the cleanest air in the world. The air pollution status is determined by the average levels of PM2.5 (particulate matter) measured over a 12-month period.
6. Places around the world that have the CLEANEST air?
There are several places around the world known for having exceptionally clean air. Some of these include Cape Grim in Tasmania, Antarctica, Zurich in Switzerland, and various remote and less populated areas with minimal human activity.
7. Where is the cleanest air in Europe?
Umeå in Sweden, Faro and Funchal in Portugal, and various other cities in Nordic countries are recognized for having the cleanest air in Europe. These cities consistently maintain high air quality standards.
8. Is air quality better near the ocean?
While the air near the ocean can be cleaner than in other areas, it is not always the case. The coastal air quality can be affected by factors such as pollution from sewage and other pollutants that are dumped into the water, which can impact the overall coastal air quality.
9. Which country has more dust?
The countries with the highest levels of dust pollution can vary depending on various factors. However, based on data from 2021, Bangladesh and Chad are recognized as two of the most polluted countries in terms of dust particles in the air.
10. Which country has more oxygen?
Bhutan is the only country in the world that is carbon negative. Its forests produce more oxygen than the country consumes, making it a unique case of a country with abundant oxygen supply.
11. Which country has the best pilots?
Countries such as the United States, Russia, and Israel have a longstanding tradition of producing highly skilled and capable fighter pilots. These countries have excelled in military aviation and have produced renowned pilots.
12. What is the cleanest country in Europe?
Iceland is considered the cleanest country in Europe. It generates 100% of its electricity from hydropower and geothermal sources, and its commitment to renewable energy and environmental protection contributes to its clean air and water quality.
13. What are the top three cleanest countries in the world?
According to the Environmental Performance Index (EPI) rankings, Denmark, Luxembourg, and Switzerland are recognized as the top three cleanest countries in the world.
14. What are the top ten cleanest countries in the world?
Based on the current rankings, the top ten cleanest countries in the world include Denmark, Luxembourg, Switzerland, United Kingdom, France, Austria, Finland, Sweden, Iceland, and Norway. These countries prioritize environmental conservation and sustainability.
15. Which country has the purest air?
Iceland, Canada, Finland, Brunei, and Estonia are among the countries known for having some of the purest air quality. These countries prioritize environmental protection and have less pollution compared to other regions.
16. Why is Finland’s air so clean?
Finland has clean air due to strong environmental regulations and investments in renewable energy. The government protects forests and lakes, promotes the adoption of electric vehicles, and has committed to the goals of the Paris Climate Agreement, resulting in cleaner air quality.
17. Which country is pollution-free?
Nordic countries like Finland, Sweden, Norway, and Iceland are known for having low pollution levels and clean air. These countries prioritize sustainable practices and have implemented strict regulations to reduce pollution and protect the environment.
18. Where do we get 70% of oxygen?
Around 70% of the Earth’s oxygen comes from photosynthesizing organisms in the ocean. These organisms, including bacteria, algae, and plants, produce oxygen through the process of photosynthesis, contributing to the majority of the Earth’s oxygen supply.
19. Why is Helsinki so clean?
Helsinki, the capital city of Finland, benefits from being located far from major European cities with high pollution levels. It has relatively few inhabitants and little traffic compared to other urban areas, contributing to its cleaner air quality. Additionally, Finland’s strong environmental regulations and investments in renewable energy play a role in maintaining clean air in Helsinki.
20. Is dust 90% skin?
Dust is made up of fine particles of solid matter. While some of the dust in homes may contain dead skin cells, it does not make up the majority of dust composition. Dust can come from various sources such as soil, pollen, fibers, and other particles found in the environment.
21. Why does Europe have less dust?
Cities in Europe and the United States implement various measures to minimize dust, such as street sweeping, regular road maintenance, and the use of dust suppressants on roads and construction sites. These practices help to reduce dust levels and maintain cleaner air in urban areas.
22. Do mountains help air quality?
While mountain air is generally associated with freshness and cleanliness, air quality at higher elevations can still be affected by pollution. However, mountains can act as physical barriers to prevent the spread of pollutants and can help disperse air pollution to some extent. Proper environmental management and measures are still important to maintain good air quality in mountainous regions.

title: 3. परबत्ता: तीन वर्ष के बाद सीएचसी में एक्स-रे सेवा हुई चालू
text:
Hindi News
Bihar News
Khagaria NewsParbatta X-Ray Service Resumed After 3 Years Road Construction Initiated
3. परबत्ता: तीन वर्ष के बाद सीएचसी में एक्स-रे सेवा हुई चालू
3. परबत्ता: तीन वर्ष के बाद सीएचसी में एक्स-रे सेवा हुई चालू3. परबत्ता: तीन वर्ष के बाद सीएचसी में एक्स-रे सेवा हुई चालू3. परबत्ता: तीन वर्ष के बाद सी
Newswrapहिन्दुस्तान, खगडि़याThu, 24 April 2025 04:44 AM
परबत्ता । एक प्रतिनिधि गत 25 जनवरी को परबत्ता सीएचसी में एक्स-रे सेवा तीन वर्ष से बंद की खबर प्रकाशित हुई। अधिकारी ने गत 9 अप्रैल को संज्ञान लिया तथा एक्स-रे सेवा शुरू की गई। वही गत 30 जनवरी को प्रखंड के सौढ़ उत्तरी पंचायत के दुधेला गांव में गत वर्ष से बाद भी नहीं सड़क निर्माण कार्य नहीं हुआ पूर्ण खबर प्रकाशित हुई और अधिकारी संज्ञान लिया। गत 17 मार्च को निर्माण कार्य शुरू किया गया। गत 4 फरवरी को प्रखंड के कुल्हड़िया पंचायत में चार वर्ष बाद भी पंचायत सरकार भवन निर्माण कार्य नहीं हुआ पूर्ण शीर्षक से खबर प्रकाशित की गई। जिसके बाद 28 मार्च से खबर के असर पर निर्माण कार्य शुरू किया गया। प्रखंड के अगुवानी घाट स्थित स्टील ब्रिज को एसपी सिंगला कंपनी द्वारा बड़ा बोल्डर रखकर बंद कर दिया गया था। जिससे वाहनों का आना जाना ठप हो गया था। गत 22 फरवरी को खबर छपी और 24 फरवरी को विभाग के अधिकारी ने संज्ञान लिया और बड़े बोल्डर को क्रेन से हटाकार वाहनों का यातायात शुरू किया गया।
फोटो:
कैप्शन: परबत्ता: सीएचसी में बंद पड़ी एक्स-रे मशीन।
फोटो: 23
कैप्शन: परबत्ता: सीएचसी में बंद पड़ी एक्स-रे मशीन को चालू करते टेक्निशियन।
